Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 20, mean = 56, sd = 4.81 Sample 2: n = 14, mean = 56, sd = 3.38. The pooled variance estimator takes the value of 18.38. It is tested Whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* A T distribution with 34 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 19 and 13 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 20 and 14 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 32 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* A T-distribution with 34 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 19 and 13 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 20 and 14 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 32 degrees of freedom: Correct
